source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖，還至彼林經行。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān had finished his meal and returned to that forest to walk.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉過彼夜後，往至佛所，到已白佛：『大德沙門，若知時者，
translation: After the night passed, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa approached the Buddha. Having arrived there, he said to him:

source_sentence: 飯食已辦。』
translation: The food and drink have been prepared.'

source_sentence: 佛告迦葉：『汝於先去，我隨後來。』
translation: The Buddha told Kāśyapa, 'First, go; I'll come after you.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於先發遣迦葉去後，即往到彼三十三天，到彼天已，取得一華，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One had previously sent forth a flower from Kāśyapa. After his departure, he went to the Trāyastriṃśa gods in the heaven of the thirty-three:

source_sentence: 其華名波梨闍多迦(隋言彼岸生)，取已於先來火神堂。
translation: The name of that flower is Pārijātaka (known in the Sui as 'birth on the Other Shore'), and after he takes it, he goes to the fire deity hall where he came before.

source_sentence: 迦葉後來，見佛已坐。
translation: Kāśyapa came back and saw the Buddha seated.

source_sentence: 即白佛言：『大德沙門！
translation: He then said to the Buddha, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 從何道來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 在於我前，到火神堂。』
translation: Be in front of me and go to the fire deity's hall.'

source_sentence: 「佛告迦葉：『我先遣汝，後至忉利天宮，將此波梨闍華來此神堂，然此波梨闍多迦華，
translation: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa: I will send you first. Later, when you return to the palace of Trāyastriṃśa gods, bring these pārijātaka flowers to this sacred hall.

source_sentence: 顏色可愛，香氣甚好，汝意若樂，可取此華嗅其香氣。』
translation: It's lovely in color and has a very nice fragrance; if you like it, take this flower and smell its fragrance.'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 此華香氣，微妙精好，沙門自持，我不合嗅。』
translation: The fragrance of this flower is subtle and delicate, and the ascetic holds it himself; I won't smell it.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力！
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa had this thought, 'This great ascetic is so powerful!'

source_sentence: 大有神通！
translation: Great is the supernormal power!

source_sentence: 乃能於先發遣我已，後到天上，取彼波梨闍多迦華，於先來坐火神堂內；
translation: Having first sent me away, he went up to heaven and took the pārijātaka flower. He was seated in the hall of the fire deity who had come before him.

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢身心寂靜如我今也。』
translation: Even so, they still can't attain the arhat's tranquility of body and mind as I am now.'

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉居處，螺髻諸梵志等，欲破於柴而不能得，若倚立者，不能屈身，
translation: At the time, Kāśyapa was staying there, and the conch-tufted brahmins and others wanted to break through the firewood but they couldn't get it; if they were to stand on it, they wouldn't bend their bodies.

source_sentence: 若低腰時，不能正直，若斧著柴，拔不能出。
translation: When he's low, he can't be upright, and if he puts an axe to firewood, he can't pull it out.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等螺髻梵志作如是念：『此之神通，必當是彼大沙門作，無有疑也，
translation: At that time, those brahmins in the conch-tufted brahmacosm thought: This supernatural power must have been done by that great renunciant.

source_sentence: 乃令我等今日不能破此柴薪，極甚勞苦。』
translation: That's why we won't be able to break through this firewood today, which is so painful and laborious.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉一切等言：『螺髻迦葉！
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān addressed those Uruvilvā Kāśyapa and others, saying, 'Conch-tufted Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝等今欲破於薪耶？』
translation: Do you now want to break through the firewood?'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『大德沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said to the Buddha, 'O great virtuous ascetic!

source_sentence: 實欲破薪，而不能得。』
translation: I really want to break down the firewood, but I can't get it.'

source_sentence: 是時，佛作如是語已，彼等梵志即得自恣破其薪柴。
translation: After the Buddha spoke these words, those priests and brāhmaṇas were allowed to break down their firewood by themselves.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力，大有神通；
translation: At that time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa had this thought: This great renunciant has great powers and great supernormal abilities.

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Even so, they still can't become arhats like I am now.'

source_sentence: 而令我等，如是辛苦，火不能燃。』
translation: They cause us to suffer so much pain that the fire won't burn them.'

source_sentence: 是時彼等迦葉報言：『大德沙門！
translation: That Kāśyapa then replied, 'That's a great virtuous ascetic!

translation: I want to burn the fire.'

source_sentence: 時佛問已，彼火即燃五百火聚。

source_sentence: 是時優婁頻螺迦葉，作如是念：『此大沙門，大有威力！

translation: At the time, those conch-tufted priests wanted to extinguish the fire but couldn't get it.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼等螺髻梵志，作如是念：『此是沙門神通之力，而令我等火炎欲滅不能得滅。』
translation: At the time, those conch-tufted priests thought, 'This is the ascetic's supernormal power that causes us to cease our burning desire and not be able to cease it.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告迦葉言：『迦葉！

translation: Do you now want to extinguish this blazing fire?'

source_sentence: 迦葉白佛：『大德沙門！

translation: Now, I want to get rid of this burning fire, but I can't get it.'

source_sentence: 時佛問已，即得滅於五百火炎。
translation: After the Buddha asked, he'll be able to extinguish the five hundred blazing flames.

source_sentence: 爾時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！

source_sentence: 其力乃能滅火即滅，欲燃即燃，雖爾；

source_sentence: 猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: They still can't become arhats like I am now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林經行而住。
translation: “After he had finished his meal, the Bhagavān returned to that forest and stayed there, walking.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志至極寒冬，天正夜半，或至後夜，嚴酷凍冷，多有風雪，
translation: At that time, when it was extremely cold in winter, those brahmins and nuns of the conch-tufted hair said to me, “In the sky at midnight on the first watch of the night or towards the evening after midnight there will be a great deal of snow and wind.

source_sentence: 入於尼連禪河水中，或沒或出，如是澡浴。
translation: He enters the water of the Nairañjanā River, either submerges or exits it, and so bathes in this way.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊以神通力，化作五百赤炭火聚，在彼岸邊。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān used his supernormal powers to transform into a cluster of five hundred red charcoal fires on the other side of the shore.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志寒噤出水住在岸邊，各各向火。
translation: At the time, those conch-tufted priests were shining coldly out of the water and staying at the shore, each facing the fire.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志心如是念：『此必定是彼大沙門作是神變，忽然有此五百火鑪，

source_sentence: 而無烟炎，使於我等從冷水出向火炙煖。』

source_sentence: 乃能化作五百鑪火，無有烟炎，令我螺髻五百弟子從冷水出向火煖坐，

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志欲取於水，各手持瓶，或將軍持，欲用取水而不能捉。
translation: At the time, those conch-tufted priests wanted to take water, each holding a pot in their hands or a general's hand, and they wanted to use it to get water but couldn't catch it.

source_sentence: 是時，彼等螺髻梵志作如是念：『此必是彼大沙門作，而令我等，不能取瓶及以軍持。』
translation: At the time, those conch-tufted brahmins had this thought, 'This must have been done by that great ascetic who caused us to be unable to take the vase and the army's support.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊告彼優婁頻螺迦葉并及五百螺髻梵志一切等言：『迦葉！

source_sentence: 迦葉白言：『善哉沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa said, 'Good, ascetic!

source_sentence: 此等五百螺髻梵志，將瓶軍持欲取於水。』
translation: These five hundred conch-tufted brahmins, holding a vase and an army, want to take the water.'

source_sentence: 時佛問已，而其五百螺髻梵志皆能將瓶及軍持等，得取於水。
translation: After the Buddha asked, the five hundred conch-tufted brahmins were able to take the water with their vases, armor, and so forth.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『希有希有！
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā Kāśyapa had this thought, 'How rare! How rare!'

source_sentence: 此大沙門大有威力！

source_sentence: 大有神通！

source_sentence: 乃能令此五百螺髻諸梵志等，許其取水乃能得水，不許不得；

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』

source_sentence: 還欲上七多羅樹上而不能上。
translation: He then wanted to go up the seven palm trees but couldn't.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼大沙門作神通無疑，令我不能上此多羅樹上祭火。』
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa had this thought, 'I'm sure it's because that great ascetic did his miraculous power without doubt so that I wouldn't be able to go up this palm tree to offer a fire sacrifice.'

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！

source_sentence: 大有神通！

source_sentence: 乃能如是，不許我等上於樹者則不能上；
translation: If you don’t allow us to go up the tree, we won’t go up.

source_sentence: 雖然，猶不得阿羅漢如我今也。』
translation: Even so, they still can't become arhats like I am now.'

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊食訖已後，還至彼林，經行而住。
translation: After he had finished his meal, the World-honored One returned to that forest and remained there.

source_sentence: 是時，優婁頻螺迦葉上七多羅樹上祭祀，上已不能安隱而住。
translation: At the time, there were seven palm trees on top of Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa and an offering on top of them, but they couldn't live peacefully above them.

source_sentence: 爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼大沙門作神通無疑，令我上此七多羅樹舊住處坐，

translation: May you hear that we'll still live here at these seven palm trees and sacrifice ourselves to the fire.'

source_sentence: 時佛語已，其迦葉等即得依舊安住彼七多羅樹上。
translation: After the Buddha spoke these words, Kāśyapa and others were able to remain in their original place among the seven palm trees.

source_sentence: 「爾時，優婁頻螺迦葉作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！

source_sentence: 是時，迦葉作如是念：『決定是彼沙門瞿曇作是神通，令我祭祀火之器具，

source_sentence: 東西馳走，狀若人驅，不能定住。』

translation: May I be allowed to have this offering of the fire altar attain certain abiding?'

translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Kāśyapa, saying, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 其祭火具即得安定。
translation: He then attained stability when he offered the fire altar.

source_sentence: 因此緣故，其迦葉等作如是念：『此大沙門大有威力！

translation: At the time, there was a great black cloud that rose up in the sky at different times and rain fell down like thunder. Wherever the Buddha lived, it didn't rain water.

source_sentence: 「爾時，世尊作如是念：『我今可令此水遍布，而於水內，復見乾地，
translation: At that time, the World-honored One had this thought:

source_sentence: 令有塵起，現經行處，於彼往來。』
translation: It causes dust to arise, presents itself as a place of practice, and goes there and comes back and forth.'
